newsitem.title: UK: NWE vacuum gas oil slips, US arb window shut tight.
newsitem.headline: NWE vacuum gas oil slips, US arb window shut tight.

text.p: High and low sulphur VGO markets were stagnant and prices softened in Europe on Friday after the fall in crude and good U.S. supply shut the trans-Atlantic arbitrage window.

With May Brent off nearly $1 in a week, vacuum gas oil values were depressed. One seller spoke of offering low sulphur for $135 fob NWE and high sulphur for $126 fob NWE, several dollars off mid-week values.
But traders said bid prices were entirely notional and there would be no buyers since the break-even point to deliver to the United States was $127 or less.
"People are offering into a vacuum at the moment," said one trader. Some limited European interest was reported and a little low sulphur barge trade was heard done on a quotes related basis.
Problems with a cat-cracker in Venezuala has pushed VGO towards Gulf coast refineries, depressing prices.
"We are waiting patiently for the arbitrage to re-open, we think this is a short-term situation," said one big European VGO supplier.
